response:
<<<api>>>: ImageIO.write(capture, "jpeg", new File(folder.toString()+"/"+filename+".jpg"));
<<<code>>>: ImageIO.write(capture, "jpeg", new File(folder.toString()+"/"+filename+".jpg"), 100);
<<<explanation>>>: You can set the compression level of the jpeg file by using the ImageIO.write method.
Question: How to get the current time in milliseconds in Java: I'm trying to get the current time in milliseconds in Java. I've tried using System.currentTimeMillis() but it returns the time in seconds. I've also tried using System.nanoTime() but it returns the time in nanoseconds. Is there any way to get the current time in milliseconds in Java?
Please using this api: System.currentTimeMillis().
Answer:<<<api>>>: System.currentTimeMillis()
<<<code>>>: System.currentTimeMillis() / 1000
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the System.currentTimeMillis() method to get the current time in milliseconds in Java.
